intro: Trigonotis laxa, commonly known as the lax trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Trigonotis laxa is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering display. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers.
